{{Infobox Political post |post = Governor |body = Minnesota |insignia = |insigniasize = |insigniacaption = |image = Mark Dayton official photo.jpg |incumbent = [[Mark Dayton]] |incumbentsince = January 3, 2011 |preceded by = |style = The Honorable |residence = [[Minnesota Governor's Residence]] |termlength = Four years, no term limit |formation = May 24, 1858 |deputy = [[Yvonne Prettner Solon]] |salary = $120,303 (2010)<ref>[http://www.stateline.org/live/details/story?contentId=207914]</ref> |website = http://www.governor.state.mn.us/ }} {{Politics of Minnesota}}
The '''Governor of Minnesota''' is the chief executive of the [[U.S. state]] of [[Minnesota]], leading the state's [[executive branch]]. Forty different people have been governors of the state, though historically there were also three governors of [[Minnesota Territory]]. [[Alexander Ramsey]], the first territorial governor, also served as state governor several years later. State governors are elected to office by popular vote, but territorial governors were appointed to the office by the [[President of the United States|United States president]]. The current governor of Minnesota is [[Democratic-Farmer-Labor Party|DFL'er]] [[Mark Dayton]].
==Powers and qualifications== Like the [[President of the United States|U.S. President]], the governor has [[veto]] power over bills passed by the [[Minnesota State Legislature]]. As in most states, but unlike the U.S. President, the governor can also make [[line-item veto]]es, where specific provisions in bills can be stripped out while allowing the overall bill to be signed into law.
The minimum required age of a candidate for the Governor of Minnesota is 25 years (having been a Minnesota resident for one year before the election).
Since a 1958 amendment to the [[Minnesota Constitution]] governors are elected to four-year terms. Previously, they served two-year terms. There is no [[term limit]] for governor of the state.<ref>{{cite web| title = The Green Papers: Minnesota 2006 Midterm Election| publisher = Richard E. Berg-Andersson, Research and Commentary| url = http://www.thegreenpapers.com/G06/MN.phtml| accessdate =2008-09-05}}</ref>
==Cabinet== The governor has a [[Cabinet (government)|cabinet]] consisting of the leaders of various state departments. The governor appoints these department heads, who are usually called [[commissioner]]s. Cabinet-level departments include:
*[[Minnesota Department of Administration|Department of Administration]] *[[Minnesota Department of Agriculture|Department of Agriculture]] *[[Minnesota Department of Commerce|Department of Commerce]] *[[Minnesota Department of Corrections|Department of Corrections]] *[[Minnesota Department of Education|Department of Education]] *[[Minnesota Department of Employment and Economic Development|Department of Employment and Economic Development]] *[[Minnesota Department of Health|Department of Health]] *[[Minnesota Department of Human Rights|Department of Human Rights]] *[[Minnesota Department of Human Services|Department of Human Services]] *[[Iron Range Resources Board]] (Also known as the IRRB <nowiki>[pronounced "eye-triple-r-b"]</nowiki>) *[[Minnesota Department of Labor and Industry|Department of Labor and Industry]] *[[Minnesota Management and Budget]] *[[Bureau of Mediation Services]] *[[Metropolitan Council]] *[[Metropolitan Sports Facilities Commission]] *[[Minnesota Department of Military Affairs|Department of Military Affairs]] *[[Minnesota Higher Education Services Office]] *[[Minnesota Housing Finance Agency]] *[[Minnesota Department of Natural Resources|Department of Natural Resources]] *[[Minnesota Pollution Control Agency]] *[[Minnesota Department of Public Safety|Department of Public Safety]] *[[Minnesota Department of Revenue|Department of Revenue]] *[[Minnesota Department of Transportation|Department of Transportation]] *[[Minnesota Department of Veterans Affairs|Department of Veterans Affairs]]
==Residence== The [[Minnesota Governor's Residence]] is located in [[Saint Paul, Minnesota|Saint Paul]], at 1006 [[Summit Avenue (St. Paul)|Summit Avenue]].
